Line 43: Line 43:
He is constantly looking for ways to earn money, generally for the purpose of impressing girls. He is often asking his dad to supplement his income or to increase his allowance. In "Debt It Be" Jackson recalls selling Miley's used tissues on the internet for $37.95. In "Achy Jakey Heart" he teams up with Oliver and opens a cheese jerky stand. In the pilot episode Jackson gets paid to model Miley's Hannah clothes for Farmane. He also holds the world record for the longest amount of time hopping on a [[pogo stick]], a feat which earned him $5,000."[[Me and Mr. Jonas and Mr. Jonas and Mr. Jonas]]" After initially failing to enter college, Jackson says that his plans for the future include collecting an inheritance from Robby and writing a tell-all book about Miley. After experiencing a [[flashforward]] in which he is an old man and still working at Rico's, Jackson's college ambition is reenergized.
He is constantly looking for ways to earn money, generally for the purpose of impressing girls. He is often asking his dad to supplement his income or to increase his allowance. In "Debt It Be" Jackson recalls selling Miley's used tissues on the internet for $37.95. In "Achy Jakey Heart" he teams up with Oliver and opens a cheese jerky stand. In the pilot episode Jackson gets paid to model Miley's Hannah clothes for Farmane. He also holds the world record for the longest amount of time hopping on a [[pogo stick]], a feat which earned him $5,000."[[Me and Mr. Jonas and Mr. Jonas and Mr. Jonas]]" After initially failing to enter college, Jackson says that his plans for the future include collecting an inheritance from Robby and writing a tell-all book about Miley. After experiencing a [[flashforward]] in which he is an old man and still working at Rico's, Jackson's college ambition is reenergized.
â
In the episode "Judge Me Tender", he gets a traffic ticket for we dint know and Robby Ray makes him pay for the ticket and he says to the president he isn't working at Rico's anymore so he has to clean up their dirty upstairs attic.
+
In the episode "Judge Me Tender", he gets a traffic ticket and Robby Ray makes him pay for the ticket and he states he isn't working at Rico's anymore so he has to clean up their, upstairs attic.
â
In "[[Miley Get Your Gum of my hair]]" Jackson saves up enough money to buy a new car and is not proud of it, until his friend Cooper tells him it's a "[[Girl car]]." Although his dad, Robby Ray, makes changes, such as changing the horn and adding a loud stereo, after Robby Ray is unable to sell it back to the original owner. Jackson eventually paints it blue.
+
In "[[Miley Get Your Gum]]" Jackson saves up enough money to buy a used car and is very proud of it, until his friend Cooper tells him it's a "[[Girl car]]." Although his dad, Robby Ray, makes changes, such as changing the horn and adding a loud stereo, after Robby Ray is unable to sell it back to the original owner. Jackson eventually paints it blue.
Jackson plays [[volleyball]] on his school team. He enjoys playing basketball until learning his father only lets him win so he will feel happy. He learns [[ping-pong]] well enough to beat his father. He is a big fan of both the "[[Los Angeles Dodgers]]" and the "[[Los Angeles Lakers]]." "[[Grandmas Don't Let Your Babies Grow Up to Play Favorites]]" He enjoys videogames, yet his portable system appears to be an original Nintendo Game Boy from the 1980s.
Jackson plays [[volleyball]] on his school team. He enjoys playing basketball until learning his father only lets him win so he will feel happy. He learns [[ping-pong]] well enough to beat his father. He is a big fan of both the "[[Los Angeles Dodgers]]" and the "[[Los Angeles Lakers]]." "[[Grandmas Don't Let Your Babies Grow Up to Play Favorites]]" He enjoys videogames, yet his portable system appears to be an original Nintendo Game Boy from the 1980s.
